Reviews.Title: “Good quality-price”
Reviews.Author: Arlen C
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The hotel is located in a good neighborhood between two metro stop, There is some stores and café and a Corte ingles that is big department store. It is few metro stop from the centrum, so if you are a tourist looking for good and nice price hotel, these one is recommended. HOTEL: The lobby is very simple, the person front desk are amable, except for one, that is kind of rude, they have a breakfast also recommended if they offer you the promotion off 50% off, if they offer you for full price forget about it, go outside and have breakfast in one of the café. The breakfast have scramble eggs, sausage, sort of breads and pastry, ham, cheese, fruit, coffee, milk and chocolate powder. The hole place is very well keep it, and have 4 elevator, that will keep you run in even in rush-hours. THE ROOM: It is a very nice and big room, will flat tv, minibar, airco, security box, toiletries amenities and extra blankets and pillows. The room was clean and made every day, also if you choose to they will change your towels every day. CONCLUSION: If you are looking for a place outside of the center, good quality-price relation, and still close enough to take either cab or metro and be there in 5 to 6 minutes, or even walking, these is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, old facility”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: NH is nicely located near the center of Madrid and at the same time with easy access to the highway. the rooms and hotel are nice. but the facility is a bit old. for instance there's only two power outlets in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Plaza Espana”
Reviews.Author: PATRACLEO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 5 min. walking distance from Plaza de Espana, and close to chopping centers. Good value for money. No restaurant available, only buffet breakfast for which you will ask discounted rate € 11 instead of € 18. Rooms are clean and with suitable toilets,those on last floor have nice view of town. Receptionists are professionally helpful in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a NH Hoteles traveler
Reviews.Content: Would use it again in going back to Madrid. The only thing is tht traffic can be noisy at times, but that is a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but the service ....”
Reviews.Author: the_expert_traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well situated in Madrid, not very central but the area has nice pedestrian area with plenty of cafe, taperias, restaurant full of local people and not so many turist. The hall is simple but clean and the room are not big but clean and moreover there isn't any carpet so it seems even cleaner. Bathroom are ok and there is wi-fi free in the hall. The only problem is the receptionist aptitude and the fact that internet connection in the room is to be paid for. If you find room only fare you can have breakfast just outside of the hotel for a couple of euros and save some money

Reviews.Title: “Modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: Thrilled_2_Travel
Reviews.Content: Registration staff was welcoming and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Although I didn't use them, toiletries were included in bathroom. Thermostat was broken, so good thing our room was at a tolerable temperature. Breakfast buffet had lots of fresh, delicious choices.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but comfortable close to the centre of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: EUConsumer
Reviews.Content: For those who want a simple, clean, well-priced hotel, albeit with the minimum of services, close to the centre of Madrid, look no further than the NH Alberto Aguilera. Bedrooms and bathrooms are comfortable without being overgenerous. The restaurant serves breakfast but is closed at other times, while room service is limited to deliveries from a nearby pizzeria.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: mikebuckland
Reviews.Content: The business hotel is reasonably well located for a visit to central Madrid but is probably best avoided if you want a quiet night's sleep. If I opened the window, I was kept awake by the traffic, which is almost 24x7. Even if I closed it, which I dislike to even with air conditioning, the traffic was very audible. There are quieter rooms away from the front, but the hotel was full so I could not be moved. If your place of work is away from the centre, you would do better to stay nearby. The building itself is rather pokey. The breakfasts were good, but this is not a cheap hotel and expensive for what you get. The reception service was attentive, polite and caring - they even offered to chase up a taxi driver if you think you have been overcharged!

Reviews.Title: “Small, simple, but efficient”
Reviews.Author: EdwinJagger
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in NH hotels quite a lot in Spain, this one was very typical of the chain. Comfortable, modern and clean, if a bit basic. On the upside: Rooms are spotlessly clean and comfortable. Bathrooms are well equipped and modern. Complimentary NH bathroom supplies (shower gel etc) are delightful. Good room service (pizza and pasta). Pretty good location, if slightly busy / noisy, but it's a city centre after all. On the downside: Rooms are a bit small, but they're fine enough for short stays. The reception staff I dealt with were abrupt and cold... but no big deal. No bar. Expected I suppose, in a 3 star. No gym or pool. Ditto. No ironing facilities. Note to hotel owners: An ironing board is a must on longer business trips! Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “rooms like closets, small ones”
Reviews.Author: hbon
Reviews.Content: This place is not worth the money. I am pretty sure the room that I booked was an elevator shaft at one time. It was barely bigger than the small, low, uncomfortable double bed that was in it. Air conditioning didn't have temperature control. I got yelled at when I took a piece of bread from their breakfast buffet. Service is rude. The only good thing is it's location, which is excellent, but I would stay at the Tripol down the street or the AC Recoletos, both of which have much nicer rooms and better service.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable. Near San Bernardo metro. Nothing to rave about.”
Reviews.Author: 0Autumn0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is OK. It's close to San Bernardo metro stop so it's easy to get around. The reception staff were friendly and the rooms clean and tidy but I've stayed in better 3 star hotels. It just doesn't wow you. It's very plain and simple. I would suggest it's on the lower end of the scale for a 3 star rated hotel. However, if you're looking for a functional hotel, not too far from the main attractions of the city, it may fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “I wanted to like it but in the end I didn't”
Reviews.Author: milkyjoeEngland
Reviews.Content: Well, this hotel certainly looks the part on first impression the rooms looked great. First initial problem was that I was hoping to pay in cash but the hotel said it was already paid when i booked it months ago. This was not true and I had taken out the money at a favourable exchange rate a month before so now I was going to have to pay at 1 euro to the pound!!!! So I forgot about that until I got home. The room - I stayed the 26th-29th of December and all I can say is the walls and ceilings were paper thin. You could hear the cleaners crashing about and moving furniture in the mornings, people flushing toilets, taking showers, talking. The road noise was acceptable because of double glazing, but there werent any blinds to pull down and the curtains didn't close fully letting in an annoying beam of light. For me I can sleep through most noises and light levels but my girlfriend hates it and she just could not sleep and because she was restless she kept me awake!! This is unacceptable for hotel that actually charges much more than i paid so I feel quite relieved in one respect! So I returned home late in the morning and checked my bank account..no money had been taken out. Next day I checked it again and there it was money taken by the Hotel not Booking.com. So that made me overdrawn and another 22 quid charges. Overall I would avoid this hotel unless you like noise, bright light and not being given the choice of how to pay (cash,card etc)

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the worst nh Hotel in the chain?”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_traveller32
Reviews.Content: Hello travellers, A few rants on this hotel so please bear with me. I arrived at this hotel a day before my partner and was told i could not check-in because my name was not on the booking, i apologised for not letting them know but was still refused even though i had all the documentation for my stay. i was informed by the 'reception manager' that i could not check-in because i could be a TERRORIST. What is the world coming too. i eventually got my partner on the phone and was allowed to check-in (he could have been anybody on the phone) it was quite comical. i was then told i couldnt have a double room because they had all been given away. i booked a double but was refused. once again the most charming reception manager told me "NO ROOM IS GUARANTEED" although it does say it is on website, so i had to change rooms for the second night. the rooms are small, the interior rooms are even smaller, so if you choose to stay here do not accept an "interior room" there is nothing to do in the hotel, room service is 12 hours a day, no restaurant, laundry on weekends. breakfast is nice and so is the power shower. i wouldnt recommend this hotel to anybody. the staff are incredibly rude and think all customers are an annoyance!!!! if you read my other reviews on hotels i have been very genuine, and im genuine on this one too. maybe i look into it a little more because i am also been a mystery shopper, which does annoy me a little in life cos im always on the lookout. if you need anymore information on this hotel please email me and i will be happy to answer your questions as best i can. Happy Travels. Preston Brookes and Carl Phillips

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and well-run, but sadly lacking in atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: davidofyork
Reviews.Content: Despite being slightly obscured by a (thankfully under-used) petrol station, the HN Alberto Aguilera certainly looks the part – a modern eight-story hotel that dominates a corner on Madrid’s busy Calle de Alberto Aguilera. Only 25-30 minutes from the airport (an evening journey, I might add) the hotel occupies a convenient location, being served by an abundance of taxis, and only a short stroll from the nearby ‘Arguelles’ or ‘San Bernardo’ Metro stations. The rooms are of an excellent standard, and appear to be regularly (and thoroughly) maintained. The only drawback is the paper-thin walls and proliferation of wooden floors, which meant that, during my stay, the tip-tapping of high heels and the dull drone of a wheeled suitcase could be easily heard from the floor above, not to mention the amorous couple in the room next door! Annoyingly, the “double” bed comprised two single beds shoved together, which kind of took away the point, but nevertheless, the mattress and pillows were very comfortable. Wi-fi is available in all of the rooms, but sadly (and all too commonly) at an extortionate cost. The mini-bar was well-stocked with a variety of products – at least for the first night that is. On a number of occasions, I had to ask for it to be re-stocked (with water, I might add – nothing stronger!). This was slightly annoying as it led to some confusion as to what items I had taken that day and what items had still to be re-stocked! Nevertheless, this was swiftly resolved by the very efficient staff, and the itemised bill at the end of my stay seemed to add up correctly. Breakfast was served in the someone soulless restaurant (the views obscured by that bloody petrol station again!), although a wide range of hot and cold buffet items more than made up for it. I never actually tried the restaurant in the evening, so I cannot vouch for the atmosphere at that time of day, although the bar always seemed somewhat under-used and it closed very early for a hotel. Overall, I would say that the three stars awarded to this hotel are pretty much justified. The hotel is a little rough around the edges perhaps in places, but overall I enjoyed a very satisfying stay at a convenient, well-run establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Ok the first night but noisy the second”
Reviews.Author: SoHappyTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Alberto Aguilera for 2 nights on a business trip. Overall it was just OK. The plus sides are it's in a good location, plenty of shopping on the door step and a Metro station a 2 minute walk away, the staff are friendly and helpful and the room was small but the bed was comfortable. On the downside, the restaurant is tiny and has a cold atmosphere the first night I ate there on my own and the second night I was one of only three people. The menu is very small, only a choice of 3 starters and the same for main courses. The room was, as I said, small but very noisy! The second night I spent in the hotel I got very little sleep because the couple next door were talking which was so clearly audible that it woke me up and kept me awake! I will try to find another hotel in Madrid the next time I travel there purely from a sleep perspective.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Mimsicle
Reviews.Content: My room was small, there were big damp patches on the ceiling BUT the bed was comfy, the bathroom clean and spacious. It was just a general ok!

Reviews.Title: “Todo excelente. Un poco caro.”
Reviews.Author: Lluis
Reviews.Content: El Hotel NH Alberto Aguilera tiene la garantia de pertenecer a la cadena hotelera NH. El hotel es nuevo y todo está muy limpio y ordenado. Es un hotel de 3 estrellas, pero en realidad hay muchos hoteles de 4 estrellas mucho peores. Se merecería tener una calificación mayor. El trato con el personal es exquisito. Son super amables. Muy buena gente. El desayuno es bufet. Es impresionante. La única pega es que el hotel es un poco caro, pero realmente vale la pena. La situación es muy buena, a diez minutos andando de la plaza de Callao o a quinze minutos de Sol. Se encuentra en una calle muy ancha y bastante transitada. Hay taxis en todo momento en la puerta del Hotel. Además, hay un Opencor a la vuelta de la esquina. El metro más cercano es San Bernardo a dos minutos andando del Hotel. Muy recomendable!!!
